Description: Mould-made pottery lamp with an oval oil-chamber, three feet and a suspension handle, which is indicated by a raised grooved element at the rear. The wick-hole at the front and the rear filling-hole are both low-placed. The front of the lamp is modelled in high relief with a winged draped woman, perhaps Psyche, holding a lantern and an inverted torch. The surface is somewhat burnished.
Bibliographic references: Lamp / Catalogue of the Lamps in the British Museum (Q1993.bis)
